text: Chionodes trophella is a moth in the family Gelechiidae. It is found in North America, where it has been recorded from Colorado, Utah, Texas, New Mexico and Arizona.Chionodes at funetmothphotographersgroup The wingspan is 15–16 mm. The basal half of the forewings is dark iridescent fuscous, intermixed with white and black scales. There is an oblique outwardly directed black costal streak at the basal third, somewhat wider at its lower end on the cell. The outer half of the forewings is shining black, with sparse white scales around the edges. There is a transverse, perpendicular, slightly outwardly angulated white fascia across the wing at the apical third. The hindwings are light shining fuscous.Proc. U.S. Nat. Mus. 25 (1304) : 860 The larvae feed on Quercus gambelii. ==References== Category:Chionodes Category:Moths described in 1903 Category:Moths of North America
title: Chionodes trophella
